channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Why the AI world is suddenly obsessed with a 160-year-old economics paradox
item.description: The primer on Jevons paradox that you didn't know you needed.
item.content:encoded: The primer on Jevons paradox that you didn't know you needed.
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosalsky

item.title: Families buy more sugary cereal if advertising targets kids, not adults
item.description: One of the top sources of added sugar in kids' diets is in their breakfast bowls. A new study shows that advertising drives sales of high-sugar cereals when it's aimed directly at kids under 12.
item.content:encoded:
One of the top sources of added sugar in kids' diets is in their breakfast bowls. A new study shows that advertising drives sales of high-sugar cereals when it's aimed directly at kids under 12.

(Image credit: Cathy Scola)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: Pastor pushed out after parishioners complain about focus on racial justice
item.description: Leaders of a Baptist church in North Carolina ousted the pastor after congregants started leaving. A secret tape provides a rare look at the debate when a message threatens a business model.
item.content:encoded:
Leaders of a Baptist church in North Carolina ousted the pastor after congregants started leaving. A secret tape provides a rare look at the debate when a message threatens a business model.

(Image credit: Sam Wolfe for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: 'Beyond betrayal.' Venezuelans in Florida are angry at Trump immigration policy
item.description: Trump's decision to remove Temporary Protected Status means more than 500,000 Venezuelans may be forced to leave the U.S. Venezuelan Americans, many of whom voted for Trump, call it a betrayal.
item.content:encoded:
Trump's decision to remove Temporary Protected Status means more than 500,000 Venezuelans may be forced to leave the U.S. Venezuelan Americans, many of whom voted for Trump, call it a betrayal.

(Image credit: Chandan Khanna)
item.dc:creator: Greg Allen

item.title: China targets U.S. coal, gas, Google as Trump tariffs take effect
item.description: Trump ordered tariffs against China, Canada and Mexico over the weekend. Canada and Mexico reached last-minute deals to pause those tariffs Monday.
item.content:encoded:
Trump ordered tariffs against China, Canada and Mexico over the weekend. Canada and Mexico reached last-minute deals to pause those tariffs Monday.

(Image credit: Andy Wong)
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: Rubio says El Salvador will house deportees from U.S., including Americans
item.description: A U.S. official said the Trump administration had no plans to try to deport American citizens. The U.S. government cannot deport American citizens and such a move would be met with legal challenges.
item.content:encoded:
A U.S. official said the Trump administration had no plans to try to deport American citizens. The U.S. government cannot deport American citizens and such a move would be met with legal challenges.

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump is weighing big cuts to the U.S. Education Department
item.description: While only Congress can shutter the department, the president is reportedly considering executive action to severely scale back its responsibilities and staffing.
item.content:encoded:
While only Congress can shutter the department, the president is reportedly considering executive action to severely scale back its responsibilities and staffing.

(Image credit: Robert Knopes)
item.dc:creator: Cory Turner

item.title: White House defends its 'Fork in the Road' offer to federal employees
item.description: The White House says the federal employees union is doing its members a disservice by urging them not to resign with the promise of administrative leave until September.
item.content:encoded:
The White House says the federal employees union is doing its members a disservice by urging them not to resign with the promise of administrative leave until September.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: Elon Musk is barreling into government with DOGE, raising unusual legal questions
item.description: The billionaire's campaign to radically upend federal agencies is stunning former White House officials, even in a political moment when many things are described as unprecedented.
item.content:encoded:
The billionaire's campaign to radically upend federal agencies is stunning former White House officials, even in a political moment when many things are described as unprecedented.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Federal judge issues restraining order blocking federal spending freeze
item.description: The order came in response to a memo released by the Office of Management and Budget last week directing agencies to freeze funding for federal grants and other programs.
item.content:encoded:
The order came in response to a memo released by the Office of Management and Budget last week directing agencies to freeze funding for federal grants and other programs.

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore
